titleStmt.title: Another of the same by Apostrophe to PHOEBVS, finishing in a symbolicall allusion, to the most noble Earle of NORTH∣HAMPTON.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Another of the same by Apostrophe to PHOEBVS, finishing in a symbolicall allusion, to the most noble Earle of NORTH∣HAMPTON.

div.head: Another of the same by Apostrophe to PHOEBVS, finishing in a symbolicall allusion, to the most noble Earle of NORTHHAMPTON.
div.l: ON, bolt on PHOEBVS, spend thy golden Shafts,
And guild these Papers with thy glorious rayes:
Crown euery leaf with leaues of flowring Bayes,
And crown the Author with thy laurell grafts.
They treat the mystical'st of generous Crafts,
That shewes what Arms were born in Antique daies,
By whom, & where, why, and how many wayes,
On Sheilds, and blades not set in dugeon haftes.
Thou, & MINERVA grace them in the sight
Of that great Lord, whose iudgment they rely on,
For as no Eye dare face thy glorious light
VVhen as Thou reignest in the golden Lion.
So dare no Curre against them ope his Iaw,
Once seis'd into the SILVER LION'S Pawe.
